LAY OUT.Definition: to explain something carefully and clearly

TRADITIONAL.Definition: following or belonging to the customs or ways of behaving that have continued in a group of people or society for a long time without changing

LOGICAL.Definition: reasonable and based on good judgment

DISCIPLINE.Definition: a particular area of study, esp. a subject studied at a college or university

METHODOLOGY.Definition: a system of ways of doing, teaching, or studying something

OBSESS.Definition: if something or someone obsesses you, or if you obsess about something or someone, you think about it, him, or her all the time

ENCOURAGES.Definition: to make someone more likely to do something, or to make something more likely to happen

HEFTY.Definition: large in amount, size, force, etc.

ENDURANCE.Definition: the ability to keep doing something difficult, unpleasant, or painful for a long time

PERSONALIZED.Definition: to make something suitable for the needs of a particular person

IN MY HUMBLE OPINION.Definition: used for expressing your opinion about something

ELIMINATED.Definition: to remove or take away someone or something

INTIMIDATING.Definition: making you feel frightened or nervous

INTROVERTED.Definition: shy, quiet, and preferring to spend time alone rather than often being with other people

SILLY.Definition: showing a lack of thought or judgment; not serious and not showing much intelligence

FOLKS.Definition: people, esp. those of a particular group or type

ON PAR.Definition: the same as or equal to someone or something

DEVOTING.Definition: to give all of something, especially your time, effort, or love, or yourself, to something you believe in or to a person

UNDERTAKING.Definition: a job, business, or piece of work

WORTHWHILE.Definition: useful, important, or good enough to be a suitable reward for the money or time spent or the effort made

FEAR NOT.Definition: used in speech to say that there is no reason to be afraid or worried

AMBITIOUS.Definition: having a desire to achieve a particular goal : aspiring

COUNTERINTUITIVE.Definition: contrary to what one would intuitively expect

NATIVES.Definition: a person born in a particular place

VALID.Definition: based on truth or reason; able to be accepted

FORUM.Definition: a place on the internet where people can leave messages or discuss particular subjects with other people at the same time

ACCOUNTABLE.Definition: responsible for and having to explain your actions

DIVERSE.Definition: including many different types of people or things

STRUGGLE.Definition: to experience difficulty and make a very great effort in order to do something

HESITATE.Definition: to pause before you do or say something, often because you are uncertain or nervous about it

PREDETERMINED.Definition: decided or arranged at an earlier time

LIKE-MINDED.Definition: people who are described as like-minded share the same opinions, ideas, or interests

COST-EFFECTIVE.Definition: if an activity is cost-effective, it is a good value for the amount of money paid

TICKLE YOUR FANCY.Definition: if something tickles your fancy, you like it and want to have it

FUNDAMENTAL.Definition: forming the base, from which everything else develops

ACCOMPLISH.Definition: to finish something successfully or to achieve something

UMBRELLA.Definition: something that includes or represents a group or range of similar things

SMALL TALK.Definition: conversation about things that are not important, often between people who do not know each other well

COMPEL.Definition: to produce a strong feeling or reaction

SNAKE OIL SALESMAN.Definition: someone who deceives people in order to get money from them

DELIVER.Definition: to achieve or produce something that has been promised
